page.title: 10Brigham Village.
page.content: Brigham is a fairly large village consisting of{Brigham Hill, High and {Low Brigham.}The A66 is a new road which by passes Brigham to the north. As well as the old houses there is a new private estate in the South East, a small council estate in the West and they are building new private houses at present. There are two small general stores one of which is also a post office. Just out of the village there is the{primary school.}A village hall stands next to the pub called The Apple Tree.At High Brigham there is a vet's surgery. There is a village policeman called{P.C.Sandham.}From the village there is a regular bus service to Cockermouth and Workington. Near the centre of the village are the {Wesleyan Chapel}and Sandra Hethering- ton's{Riding Stables.}At Low Brigham is{St. Bridget's Church}begun in 1080.
